name: 'Night Bus' by Dan Sully
description: Exclusive limited edition of 50   Paper size: 330­mm x 330mm  Image size: 300mm x 300mm  C-type print. Fuji Crystal Archive Paper 'Night Bus' by film-maker and photographer Dan Sully manages to find beauty in unusual places. The print is part of a series exploring the atomisation and detatchment of modern urban living. 'I guess a lot of my pictures have a slightly cold, formal quality to them but that wasn't predetermined... It's just what I'm drawn to. This was one of the first images I shot and I am particularly fond of the angelic look on the young man's face and of how the light inside the bus falls on it.' Dan is working on finishing the Night Bus series and will exhibit mid-2013. His first short film - The Ellington Kid - premiered at the London Film Festival 2012 and is currently touring UK cinemas.

name: 'Dochula' by Maja Flink
description: Exclusive limited edition of 50 Paper size: 297mm x 420mm Image size: 266mm x 266 mm C-type print. Fuji Crystal Archive Paper Dochula explores the serenity of a small corner of Bhutan, a remote kingdom, nestling in the Himalayas between its powerful neighbours, India and China. "We were driving from one town to another and drove by this mountian pass where the view is usually very striking. This afternoon the fog was very thick so instead we walked up into the forrest and found hundreds of prayer flags" Maja Flink has recently exhibited in Stockholm and Nigeria.

name: 'Curfew' by Mustafa Khalili
description: Exclusive limited edition of 50  Paper size: 297mm x 420mm  Image size: 180 mm x 390 mm  C-type print. Fuji Crystal Archive Paper 'Curfew' is part of a series of images shot in the West Bank and Gaza between 2001 and 2003, exploring the personal experience of the individual in unfamiliar and hostile times. "I went to downtown Ramallah, 'al-Manara'  one night to see if there was anything going on. The streets were empty and even the Israeli army were not in their usual positions.  I set up to shoot a picture of this eerily empty street. After 10-15 minutes I heard the sirens of an ambulance. I quickly adjusted my position further down the street just incase it came my way. Of all the empty streets it could have driven down, it came my way…" Mustafa Khallili has been shooting photography for over 17 years and recently won two Webby Awards for his work in Haiti and Egypt.

name: 'Harmony Punks' by Leon Diaper
description: Exclusive limited edition of 50 Paper size: 297mm x 420mm Image size: 266mm x 266 mm C-type print. Fuji Crystal Archive Paper 'Harmony Punks explores the beauty in abandonment, decay and the wild pioneering spirit of the Colorado Desert, in southeast California. The image of a disused world war two bunker became the cover art for The Vaccines single Wreckin' Bar (Ra Ra Ra) / Blow It Up (Marshall Teller Records). "My photography is weird and wonderful, involving a fair bit of nostalgia but always focusing on the romance of the subject" Leon Daiper's critically acclaimed solo show A Lost Youth at Glaerie Maxence Malboise, Paris in 2011 continued to explore the unorthodox beauty found between the cracks in modern society.

name: 'Sea Pool' by Percy Dean
description: Exclusive limited edition of 50 Paper size: 297mm x 420mm Image size: 378mm x 250 mm C-type print. Fuji Crystal Archive Paper Sea Pool is an examination of the insignificance of our lives, worries and thoughts and a warning against introversion. ''My style evolves year to year and project to project, I find I am a different person when faced with differing subject matter or my own intent. I guess I am direct, I like being alone.'' Percy Dean has been taking photographs for over 20 years. He founded the influential skateboard/lifestyle magazine Document in 1997 and worked there for over a decade. His recent projects have included The Seven Sisters of Siolim, a return to the seven convents of Siolim in Goa, and For Mr Chistoulas a series of images inspired by the suicide note left in Syntagma Square, Athens by Dimitris Christoulas Percy regularly returns to this sea pool on the south coast of Cornwall to swim.
